logo.text: Michigan State University Dissertation Topic Network

text.title: Michigan State University Dissertation Topic Network
text.more:
This network is showing clusters of related subjects of research at Michigan State University. Whenever someone submits their dissertation, they choose a handful of subjects that describe their dissertation. These subjects come from a predefined list.

The edge weights in this network are defined by how often the subjects co-occur on a thesis. So if 10 theses both have "Ecology" and "Computer Science" as subjects, the edge weight between "Ecology" and "Computer Science" is 10. The stronger an edge weight is between two subjects, the more they are considered closely related in this graph.

Data was provided by Devin Higgins from Michigan State University. The code and data for this project are available on GitHub: https://github.com/rhiever/dissertation-topic-network

If you would like to visualize similar data from your own university, please contact Randy Olson to discuss collaboration.
text.intro: This is a visualization of Masters and PhD dissertation topics from Michigan State University.
